question: So where's Buckaroo?
answer: Whadda you need Buckaroo for? Unscheduled surgery. He'll be waltzing along momentarily. What're you doing tonight?

question: Flying to Cambodia.
answer: That's why I wear a fifty dollar hat. Was a two hundred dollar hat, I hadda kill you.

question: Bet you say that to all the girls, Perfect Tommy.
answer: Bet I do.

question: The Overthruster! The Overthruster! The Overthruster!
answer: Almost ready, Dr. Lizardo...almost...

question: More! More!
answer: Not so fast...

question: I heard somebody crying. I said is someone out there crying in the darkness?
answer: Here...here at the back. I'm sorry...

question: Raise your hand...where?
answer: This is so embarrassing...

question: Somebody get her a mike? Can we manage that? And a spotlight. What's your name?
answer: Penny. I'd rather not reveal my last name or my age.

question: Did you say..."Peggy"?
answer: My name is Penny. Penny Priddy. There I've said it, but it won't mean anything to you. I'm a nobody.

question: Nobody's a nobody. Why're you crying? What's wrong?
answer: Did I say anything was wrong? I just sponged up a little too much Vat 69, okay? I'm down to my last nickel in this lousy town, I can't get my luggage outta hock 'cause I met this jerk who said he was a record producer when all he had was a record. He offered to set me up for life, and like a fool, well, I...

question: He offered you money?
answer: Do I look like that kinda girl? I lost my room this morning. I don't know where I'm gonna sleep tonight, but I keep going. What the hell else can I do? I've still got my figure, and like this bozo said, as long as there's a sidewalk, I'll always have a job.

question: Remember it's always darkest just before the dawn. Believe me, I've been there. This song's for Peggy. And all you others out there a little down on your luck.
answer: My name's, Penny! But who cares? Let me go, let me go, you creeps...

question: Pick those up, Reno.
answer: I didn't drop 'em.

question: It's a spittin' image.
answer: Doesn't look anything like her to me.

question: Pictures don't lie.
answer: Hell they don't. I met my first wife that way.

question: The name's Reno. This here's Perfect Tommy.
answer: Where do you hail from, Doc? Reno, how's about you take New Jersey's gear, mosey on over to the bus and introduce him to the rest of the hands.

question: Why me?
answer: Cause Buckaroo needs me here.

question: What're you doing here? Why're you looking at me like that?
answer: I guess 'cause you remind me of someone I once knew, long ago before any of this craziness.

question: Go away. Let me rot?
answer: Who were you really trying to kill last night?

question: You. Like the papers all say.
answer: Pretty terrible shot.

question: Was she pretty?
answer: Who?

question: The girl I remind you of.
answer: She was the Queen of the Netherlands.

question: It's kinda hard this way.
answer: I'd turn around, but I'm afraid you'd strangle me.

question: The Netherlands. Whew, that's a long way from Wyoming.
answer: Wyoming? Not Cody, by any chance?

question: No. Laramie. Except I was born in Cody. How did you know that? Oh, right, sure, I forgot
answer: No, I don't. Having a little trouble with that knot, aren't you?

question: Which? The one in my throat.
answer: Did you have family there--? A sister? In Cody?

question: I don't know. I always felt like I did, like there was another me...
answer: Another 'you'?

question: Somewhere. See I was taken away by the Priddies when I was a baby. I was adopted.
answer: Adopted. I should have know. Of course. If it was a snake, it'd bit me!

question: What? I don't understand you. I don't understand anything anymore.
answer: Who does? It's a crazy mixed-up world. Just do the best you can with what you have...

question: Who does? It's a crazy mixed-up world. Just do the best you can with what you have...
answer: Running a little late, Buckaroo.

question: Let her out. In my custody.
answer: Let her out? She's a killer.

question: The President's calling you, Buckaroo.
answer: The president of what?

question: The President of the United States.
answer: Is he still delirious?

question: What? A black ship? Where? A black thermopod's been shot down ten miles back.
answer: John Whorfin...maybe they know he's escaped!

question: I have a radio fix...
answer: Death to the enemy!

question: Rawhide. Come in. Over.
answer: Over, Buckaroo. What's up? Where in Hades are you? I'm getting a lotta static.

question: That's me. I've been ionized, but I'm okay. I'm, switching on the homing beacon, mark two minute intervals.
answer: Buckaroo, somebody shanghaied the Professor!

question: The deuce you say. That crate!
answer: What crate?

question: I think I'm on to something. You and the guys go back to the house and dig up everything you can on an outfit called Yoyodyne.
answer: Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems? You think they're mixed up in this?

question: How long you been riding with Buckaroo, Reno?
answer: Nigh on ten years. Been through a lotta scrapes together.

question: What'd you do before? Can I ask?
answer: Government work. Had my own think tank. Got tired of thinking-wanted some action. Seen plenty of it too. So will you if you stick around.

question: Where's Buckaroo? Is he alive?
answer: Course he's alive. He's Buckaroo Banzai.

question: Looks like nothing I ever seen. I seen droids in space movies, but they're nothing like this-
answer: It's a three-man thermopod...

question: Thermopod? What's a... Yeah, well, I was gonna call Buckaroo Banzai out here to have a look. Right up his alley, I think. Not yet. I said I was gonna. Go on! Keep it moving!
answer: We got a truck on the way to mop things up for you. Else this place could become a zoo, not to mention a haven for gawkers.

question: Buckaroo! What the Sam Hill!
answer: Careful...don't make noise and don't touch me. I'm hotter than flapjacks.

question: What?
answer: I'm a giant semi-conductor, and there's alien creatures all around us. Form the Eighth Dimension, I think. Look...

question: You can see them?
answer: Ever since that phony phone call from the President. Look at this. What is it?

question: It's your hand, Buckaroo.
answer: It's an antidote. A formula. Whoever it was on the phone made me scribble this and gave me the ability to penetrate their disguises.

question: Antidote to what? Whose disguises?
answer: Arachtoids. From Planet Ten.

question: Planet 10?
answer: There's a Harley behind those bushes. Get back to the laboratory and start working on the formula. We don't have time to ask questions. Just synthesize it-

question: Buckaroo, the formula--
answer: Hurry! Please.

question: I'm sure the boys like you. They just don't wanna get attached...and then see what happened to Buckaroo's last sweetheart happen to you.
answer: What happened to her?

question: You know any judo?
answer: Any what?

question: Don't worry, I won't hurt you.
answer: What's up those stairs?

question: Hi, buddy, what can I do for ya?
answer: Buckaroo Banzai?

question: You a messenger? What've you got here?
answer: I need see Buckaroo Banzai in person. My name is John Parker. Identify yourself.

question: Open up or I'll shoot it off.
answer: I'll shoot yours off if I had a gun, you double-dealing Casanova! I thought you liked me for myself. But why should you, huh? A jerk like me.

question: Penny, look- That's kinda complicated to get into right now because the world's maybe coming to an end and I can't stand here and talk to a closet door. Penny, I was going to get into that, but I haven't had time...with arachtoids and all...but briefly she was your long lost twin sister, we got married, and that's about all I can say. Right now. Penny?
answer: Married--? So that's it! Buckaroo Banzai, a married man. Where is she? With the kids some place? She must've been a bigger fool than me if she ran out on a guy like you...

question: She was killed, Penny.
answer: Oh, my.

question: Don't go to pieces. I haven't got time tonight.
answer: Looks like you're the one might go to pieces.

question: Where's my damn ammo? Nothing is ever where it's supposed to be around here!
answer: How did she die? I wanna know.

question: You don't wanna know.
answer: Yes, I do. Gimme a chance. I'm stronger than you think.

question: She was murdered by Hanoi Shan on our wedding night.
answer: Hanoi Shan--? The guy in your comic books. Boss of the World Crime League? Supreme Commander of the Legion of Death? The Pivot of Mystery himself? You're putting me on. He's a cartoon character.

question: I wish he was. He's real enough.
answer: God, she's so young and beautiful. I don't remember her at all. Which I guess is good, under the circumstances. I bet you'll never forget her though.

question: Never.
answer: I gotta be honest with myself and not repress these feelings-I've got mixed emotions-I don't know if I can handle this. Oh, boy...

question: I gotta go. We're on borrowed time.
answer: Go where? Where're you going?

question: Please, Penny. You just gotta trust me now. Okay? And don't panic. Because it's gonna be all right.
answer: What? If we just believe in Buckaroo Banzai?

question: Yeah...and maybe more important, if you believe in yourself.
answer: Believe in Penny Priddy?

question: Absolutely.
answer: You've got your six guns strapped on. You're ridding off on another adventure? Oh, my God, it's all real...it really is real. I should go with you. Please...

question: It's too dangerous.
answer: That's just what you would say. This is so unreal. I'm dreaming...

question: Spread out. They can't be far.
answer: Look out, Buckaroo! Behind you!

question: You okay?
answer: Yeah. Just grazed me. The Professor's under the floor too...with the Overthruster...

question: You're a welcome sight...
answer: Just 'grazed' you, huh?

question: Apache?
answer: Arachtoid.

question: As are all sane men today. World Watch One. Direct incoming transmission.
answer: Hello, Mr. President. How's my favorite patient? Any tenderness?

question: That which does not kill us makes us stronger, Buckaroo. What's it like out there in the real world?
answer: Not too terrific, sir. I apologize for the interruption but something very unusual has reared its ugly head in outer space, and it looks like the Earth's caught in a crossfire.

question: Damn Buckaroo! I'm the eyes and ears of the President of these United States of America! In loco presidentis! Which means I'm in charge here!
answer: Not on this bus, you're not.

question: Who the hell do you think you are?
answer: Perfect Tommy.

question: Well let me tell you something, Mr. Perfect Tommy Hit it, soldier boy! Move this buggy! That's a goddamn executive order!
answer: Go ahead, Louie, do like the man says. Hey, so we get into action quicker this way. We tell Buckaroo our watches were fast.

question: Does this thing have guns, John Parker?
answer: Boy, I hope so, Buckaroo Banzai.

question: Take the throttle, John Parker! Pull up! We did it! Holy shit, we did it! Pull up!
answer: Now, Buckaroo Banzai?
